translated: Catalog of Newly Requested Scriptures and Others
Table of Newly Requested Scriptures and Others
Esoteric Buddhist monk KÅ«kai says: I left in the 23rd year of the Enryaku era.
In the end of my stay studying abroad,
I inquired about the way ten thousand miles away.
In the twelfth month of that year, I arrived in Chang'an.
On the 10th day of the second month in the 24th year,
by imperial decree, I was assigned to live at Ximing Temple.
Then, I traveled to various temples,
seeking a teacher to rely on.
Fortunately, I met the abhiseka acharya of Qinglong Temple, whose dharma name was Huiguang.
I took him as my teacher.
That great virtuous one was the dharma heir of Amoghavajra, the great tripiá¹­aka master of Daxingshansi, who was very wise.
He was well-versed in the sutras and vinaya, and thoroughly understood the secret treasury.
He was the leader of the Dharma,
the teacher of the country.
The great master valued the spread of the Buddha Dharma,
and lamented that the people could be saved.
He bestowed upon me the precepts for generating the bodhi mind.
He allowed me to enter the consecration ritual arena.
I bathed and received the consecration of wisdom twice.
I received the position of ÄcÄrya once.ğŸ”½Crawling on elbows and knees, learning what has not been learned.
Bowing the head to the feet, hearing what has not been heard.
Fortunately relying on the great creation of the state and the compassion of the great master.
Studying the great Dharma of the two divisions.
Practicing the yoga of the various honored ones.
This Dharma is the liver and heart of all Buddhas.
The direct path to becoming a Buddha.
In the country it is a fortress, in people it is the essence.
Therefore, those with little fate do not hear its name.
Heavy defilements cannot enter.
In India, the Tripiá¹­aka master Åšubhakarasiá¹ƒha removed his sandals and leaned on a staff. In China, Emperor Xuanzong admired him and forgot the taste of food.
From then on.
One person, the three offices, enjoyed the martial arts.
The four assemblies and the myriad people bowed their heads and beat their chests.
The school of the secret treasury proclaimed itself the emperor from this point on.
The half-pearl of the exoteric teachings is bound with a face flag.
As for.
When the phoenix flies, it must look up to Yao and Shun.
The practice and storage of the Buddha Dharma follow the times, rolling up and unfolding.
Now there are more than a hundred parts of the Vajra Vehicle teachings.
The two parts of the great maá¹‡á¸ala ocean assembly are invited to come and be seen.
Although it is said that the waves are vast and the wind and rain drift the ship,
Crossing the whale sea, it peacefully reaches the sacred realm.
This is the power of the sages.
I humbly think that the supreme virtue of the Emperor is like heaven.
The Buddha sun turns high.
The father of the people is the transformation of the Buddha.
He feels pity for the sentient beings and wets his feet.
He is entrusted by the Buddha and wears his clothes.
Since Your Majesty has newly ascended the throne,
The newly translated sÅ«tras come from afar and newly arrive.
Since Your Majesty nurtures the people of the country with kindness,
The image of the ocean assembly comes across the ocean.
It is just like a matching talisman.
Who else but a sage could fathom this?
Even if KÅ«kai deserves the crime of missing the deadline, he would die without regret.
I am overjoyed that the Dharma, which is difficult to obtain, has been born and requested to come.
I am unable to bear the utmost fear and joy.
I respectfully entrust this to the official of the sixth rank, the great supervisor of the great minister of the right, Gao Kai, the true person of distant accomplishment.
I respectfully present this memorial.
And I request the newly translated sutras and other catalogs in one volume.
I humbly offer this, lightly defiling the majestic dignity.
I am even more terrified.
The monk KÅ«kai is truly afraid and truly alarmed, I respectfully say.

On the twenty-second day of the tenth month of the first year of DaitÅ, the monk KÅ«kai who studied the Dharma in Tang presented a memorial. The monk KÅ«kai who studied the Dharma in Tang requested the sutras, vinaya, treatises, commentaries, biographies, and other texts that he brought back in the first year of DaitÅ.

Dharma mandala.

The objects entrusted by the ÄcÄrya, the catalog totals six kinds.
Among them.
A total of 142 new translations of sutras in 247 fascicles.
A total of 42 texts in 44 fascicles of Sanskrit mantras and praises.
A total of 32 texts in 170 fascicles of commentaries and treatises.
The above three types total 216 texts in 461 fascicles.
Statues of Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, Vajras, and other deities.
Dharma mandalas.
Samaya mandalas.
Together with portraits of Dharma-transmitting acharyas, totaling 10 sets.
Nine kinds of ritual implements.
Thirteen kinds of objects entrusted by acharyas.

the great Tang Dynasty's special envoy, chief minister for making loud announcements, added rank of Kaifuyi Sansi, enfeoffed as Duke of Su, posthumous title of Minister of Works, posthumous name of Greatly Eloquent and Vastly Wise, Tripiá¹­aka Master Amoghavajra's translations.
The Dharma ocean has one taste, but the capacities of beings vary in depth.
The five vehicles divide into different paths, following the gradual and sudden teachings.
Within the sudden teaching, there is the exoteric and the esoteric.
In the esoteric treasury, there are the source and the branches.
The ancient Dharma masters swam in the branches and clung to their duties.
What is transmitted now is to uproot and exhaust the source.
Why is this so?
In the past, Vajrasattva personally received it from the Vairocana TathÄgata.
Hundreds of years later, he bestowed it upon NÄgÄrjuna Bodhisattva.ğŸ”½NÄgÄrjuna Bodhisattva bestowed it upon NÄgabodhi Ä€cÄrya.
NÄgabodhi Ä€cÄrya bestowed it upon Vajrabodhi Ä€cÄrya.
The Tripiá¹­aka master Vajrabodhi first transmitted the five divisions during the Kaiyuan era of the Great Tang.
Although it is said that he was revered by one person,
it could not spread widely.
Only our ancestor, the great master of vast wisdom,
first received it from the Tripiá¹­aka master Vajrabodhi.
He then went to the master of NÄlandÄ in South India.
He grasped the eighteen assemblies of yoga.
He thoroughly researched the secret treasury of the womb and so forth.
During the Tianbao era, he returned to the Great Tang.
At that time, Emperor Xuanzong first received the abhiá¹£eka.
He humbled himself as the teacher's disciple.
From Emperor Suzong to Emperor Daizong, they all received the Dharma in succession.ğŸ”½In the imperial palace, he built the Shenlong Monastery.
In the city, he universally opened the abhiá¹£eka altar.
One person and hundreds of officials attended the altar to receive the abhiá¹£eka.
The fourfold assembly and the common people studied the secret treasury on foot.
The teachings of the secret treasury flourished that day.
The method of abhiá¹£eka has continued since then.
Moreover, the exoteric teachings discuss the distant eons of the three great ones.
The secret treasury then expects the great birth of the sixteenth.
Slow and fast, superior and inferior, are like the divine powers of a lame donkey.
The guest who looks up to goodness will understand its direction.
The superiority and inferiority of the teachings, the beginning of the Dharma,
Like the five secret ritual manuals of Vajrasattva,
And the letters and answers of the Tripiá¹­aka Master of Great Eloquence and Correctness, etc., are explained in detail.

The Buddhist teachings are vast and boundless.
In one word, they are all about the two benefits: the benefit for oneself is to attain the fruition of constant bliss;
the benefit for others is to deliver them from suffering and emptiness.
